subject: Drafting & presentation of Statement of Defence before Arbitral Tribunal and moving applications/ appeals before Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts.
text: HRdly <rzty TTHTf xifetarut qh9 IPhone 91-11-25074100/25074200 Remove Watermnark Now (8m TRar7 3k)_TrTHTf HATGT) #4/ Fax 91-11-25093507 25uy3514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) f-5 & 6, #2r-10 , ERa, # ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/Dispute Resolution & legal matters/ 2019 No.2.1.29 /2019 dated the iOJuly, 2019 [Decision taken on File No. NHAI/DRGA/Arb (Misc)/2018] Sub: Drafting & presentation of Statement of Defence_before Arbitral Tribunal and moving applications/ appeals before Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts Attention of officers concerned is drawn to Para(A)6.3 & 6.4, Page-6 & 7; Para(A)7.1, Page-8; Para(B)1.3, Page-9/10; and Para(B)2, Page-11 of   Policy Guidelines dated 01.06.2017 o drafting of submissions of NHAI before the Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts. 2_ While deliberating issues related to the acceptance/ challenge of Arbitral Awards, Executive Committee of NHAI has observed that quantification/ calculations of the claims of the Contractors/ Concessionaires are not   being carefully examined and defended with justifications before the Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts. Mostly, NHAI takes a position of claim rejection with zero amount and the Contractors/ Concessionaires present their claims with highest possible amounts. The Arbitration/ Court matters go by the contractual/ legal interpretations/ logics and once the interpretations/ logics are established, the Contractor / Concessionaire is awarded the claimed amounts: However , there may be a case wherein, if the interpretations/ logics of the Contractor/ Concessionaire are to be believed, the quantification of claim may not be as much as presented by the Contractor / Concessionaire and if such calculations were available before the Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts; it might have awarded lower amount: 3_ In view of the above, it has been decided that all Regional Officers shall ensure that in all the Arbitration/ Court matters of the projects within their jurisdictions, the arithmetic/ logical check of the claims of Contractors/ Concessionaires shall be done through the Engineer of the project; Project Director & Techno-legal expert and Opinion of NHAI on the calculations will have to be given by the field officers in all cases, Thereafter , same shall be forwarded by the Regional Officer along with his comments. While rejecting claims with zero eligible amount before Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts, the calculations arrived at by NHAI shall be  shared with the Counsel appearing on behalf of NHAI with the rider that "without prejudice to the rights & contentions, the NHAI submits that assuming for the sake of argument; but not admitting that if the contention of the Claimant is found correct; the actual amount comes to Rs. 4_ Competent Authority approving such Statement of Defence/ Appeal/ Petition may also check such calculations arrived at by NHAI in the documents to be presented before the Arbitral Tribunals/ Courts.
